Package com.agilebank.service.transaction

Class TransactionService

java.lang.Object
com.agilebank.service.transaction.TransactionService
@Service public class TransactionService extends Object
Service class for transactions. Supports TransactionController by providing methods for retrieving a single or multiple transactions, storing new transactions, and deleting transactions.
Author:
jason
See Also:

  • TransactionRepository

  • Constructor Details

    • TransactionService

      public TransactionService()

  • Method Details

    • storeTransaction

      @Transactional public TransactionDto storeTransaction(TransactionDto transactionDto)
      Store a new transaction in the database.
      Parameters:
      transactionDto - The TransactionDto with the information of the new transaction to persist.
      Returns:
      A TransactionDto with the information of the just persisted transaction in the database (if everything goes ok).
      See Also:
      • TransactionSanityChecker

    • getTransaction

      @Transactional(readOnly=true) public TransactionDto getTransaction(Long id) throws TransactionNotFoundException
      Retrieve a single transaction by its unique ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique DB id of a transaction.
      Returns:
      A TransactionDto describing the transaction identified by id.
      Throws:
      TransactionNotFoundException - If there is no transaction identified by id in the database.

    • getAllTransactions

      @Transactional(readOnly=true) public List<TransactionDto> getAllTransactions()
      Retrieve all the transactions in the database.
      Returns:
      A List with all the transactions that are stored in the database.

    • getAllTransactionsFrom

      @Transactional(readOnly=true) public List<TransactionDto> getAllTransactionsFrom(Long sourceAccountId)
      Get all the transactions beginning from a given source account.
      Parameters:
      sourceAccountId - The unique DB Id of the source account for all the transactions we want.
      Returns:
      A List of all transactions with the source account corresponding to sourceAccountId.

    • getAllTransactionsTo

      @Transactional(readOnly=true) public List<TransactionDto> getAllTransactionsTo(Long targetAccountId)
      Get all the transactions to a given target account.
      Parameters:
      targetAccountId - The unique DB Id of the target account for all the transactions we want.
      Returns:
      A List of all transactions with the target account corresponding to targetAccountId.

    • getAllTransactionsBetween

      @Transactional(readOnly=true) public List<TransactionDto> getAllTransactionsBetween(Long sourceAccountId, Long targetAccountId)
      Get all the transactions beginning from a given source account and to a given target account.
      Parameters:
      sourceAccountId - The unique DB id of the source account for all the transactions we want.
      targetAccountId - The unique DB Id of the target account for all the transactions we want.
      Returns:
      A List of all transactions with the source and target accounts correponding to the IDs provided.

    • deleteTransaction

      @Transactional public void deleteTransaction(Long id) throws TransactionNotFoundException
      Hard-Delete the transaction corresponding to the provided id.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique DB id of the transaction to delete.
      Throws:
      TransactionNotFoundException - If there is no transaction with id id in the DB.

    • deleteAllTransactions

      @Transactional public void deleteAllTransactions()
      Hard-delete all the transactions in the database, emptying the relevant table.
